The Gielinor Guide (formerly RuneScape Guide) is the first non-player character (NPC) that players meet in the game. He is found in his house on Tutorial Island. He gives a brief but informative chat about the game.

At this NPC, a player is required to choose their character's looks. These include:

  • Male / Female
  • Hair style / colour
  • Body style / colour
  • Legs style / colour
  • Arms style
  • Feet style / colour (brown or black)

Transcript[edit | edit source]

This article on an NPC has an associated dialogue page.
Click here for a transcript of possible conversations with this NPC.
Transcripts Gielinor Guide speaks in:
  • Transcript of Tutorial Island

Gallery (historical)[edit | edit source]

  • Appearance during the RuneScape 2 beta

Trivia[edit | edit source]

  • He appears to be wearing a sleeveless red Saradomin platebody and a red beret.
  • His name and examine was changed to refer to the game's world, Gielinor, rather than RuneScape, in an update on 11 October 2018.

[[File:Gielinor Guide chathead.png|left]]
The '''Gielinor Guide''' (formerly '''RuneScape Guide''') is the first [[non-player character]] (NPC) that players meet in the game. He is found in his house on [[Tutorial Island]]. He gives a brief but informative chat about the game.

At this NPC, a player is required to choose their [[character]]'s looks.
These include:
*[[Gender|Male / Female]]
*[[Hairdresser|Hair style / colour]]
*[[Thessalia|Body style / colour]]
*[[Thessalia|Legs style / colour]]
*[[Thessalia|Arms style]]
*[[Thessalia|Feet style / colour (brown or black)]]

==Transcript==
{{Hastranscript|npc}}

==Gallery (historical)==
<gallery captionalign="center" widths="200">
Gielinor Guide (2003).png|Appearance during the RuneScape 2 beta
</gallery>

==Trivia==
*He appears to be wearing a sleeveless red [[Saradomin platebody]] and a [[red beret]].
*His name and examine was changed to refer to the game's world, [[Gielinor]], rather than RuneScape, in [[Update:Spellbook Rework, Wise Old Man and, Increased Zoom|an update]] on [[11 October]] [[2018]].
